abstract.text: Choose colors for UI elements such as labels, text, backgrounds, and links.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: UIKit provides color objects for the foreground and background colors of your app’s UI elements. The names of these color objects reflect their intended use, rather than specific color values.
Except where noted, the color objects adapt automatically to Dark Mode changes when you use the provided
object. If you retrieve the color values, either directly or using another type such as
, you must handle Dark Mode changes yourself. For more information about supporting Dark Mode, see

abstract.text: A set of components that define a color, with a color space specifying how to interpret them.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity.
The nonadaptable system color for text on a light background.
The system color to use for the background of a grouped table.
The color for text labels that contain primary content.
The nonadaptable system color for text on a dark background.
The specified color for links.
The color for borders or divider lines that hides any underlying content.
The color for placeholder text in controls or text views.
The color for text labels that contain quaternary content.
An overlay fill color for large areas that contain complex content.
The system pattern color to use for the area behind scrollable content.
The color for text labels that contain secondary content.
The color for content layered on top of the main background.
An overlay fill color for medium-size shapes.
The color for content layered on top of the main background of your grouped interface.
The color for thin borders or divider lines that allows some underlying content to be visible.
The color for the main background of your interface.
An overlay fill color for thin and small shapes.
The color for the main background of your grouped interface.
The color for text labels that contain tertiary content.
The color for content layered on top of secondary backgrounds.
An overlay fill color for large shapes.
The color for content layered on top of secondary backgrounds of your grouped interface.
A color value that resolves at runtime based on the current tint color of the app or trait hierarchy.
The system pattern color to use for the background of a page.
The system color to use for the back side of a view when it’s flipped.
Load colors from asset catalogs and create colors from raw component values.
Configure your app’s drawing environment using colors, renderers, draw paths, strings, and shadows.
Define standard color objects for specific shades, such as red, blue, green, black, white, and more.
Update colors, images, and behaviors so that your app adapts automatically when Dark Mode is active.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Supporting Dark Mode in Your Interface
